election_record.label: Maine 1824 Electoral College, At Large

overview.note: Some, if not all of the scattering votes may have been for Joshua Gage. Originally he was a Crawford "at large" Elector, but withdrew in mid-September.

sub_unit.name: Cape Elizabeth
sub_unit.note: The Eastport Sentinel (Eastport, ME) lists William Chadwick with 66 votes.

sub_unit.name: Portland
sub_unit.note: The Eastport Sentinel (Eastport, ME) lists William Chadwick with 414 votes and Peleg Tallman with 415 votes.

sub_unit.name: Westbrook
sub_unit.note: The Eastport Sentinel (Eastport, ME) lists William Campbell and Thomas Fillebrown with 57 votes.

sub_unit.name: Hancock
sub_unit.note: County vote totals include the votes from Washington County.

sub_unit.name: Mount Vernon
sub_unit.note: The American Advocate of November 6, 1824, reported that Mt. Vernon: "was unanimous for the Adams ticket, but we are not informated what number of votes was thrown."

sub_unit.name: Hampden
sub_unit.note: Campbell and Fillebrown received all votes.

election_record.reference: Register of the Maine Governor's Council. Vol I. 289-290.
